query: Use search to find the official NOAA page on the Gulf of Mexico and give a 1-line summary with the domain.

messages.content: You are a research assistant that answers with concise, well-structured responses. When you need fresh facts, call tools. Always cite sources with domain names when using search/fetch results. Prefer bullet points for lists.
Use search to find the official NOAA page on the Gulf of Mexico and give a 1-line summary with the domain.

Style rules: If you used tools, include a 'Sources:' section with domains.; Keep answers factual; avoid speculation.; If the question is ambiguous, ask one targeted clarifying question before proceeding.

[...] NOAA's Gulf of Mexico Disaster Respons"}, {"title": "Gulf of America", "url": "https://www.aoml.noaa.gov/phod/gom/", "snippet": "The Gulf of America (also known as the Gulf of Mexico) is a semi-enclosed basin connected, to the south, to the Caribbean Sea, and to the North Atlantic Ocean to the east. The main dynamical feature of the Gulf of America is the Loop Current, which is a portion, upstream of the Gulf Stream, of the North Atlantic western boundary current that carries ocean waters from the Tropics towards the high latitudes. The Loop Current indeed carries warm waters from the Caribbean Sea into the colder Gulf [."}, {"title": "Offshore Waters Forecast (Gulf of America)", "url": "https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/text/MIAOFFNT4.shtml", "snippet": "Offshore Waters Forecast (Gulf of America)

final:
The official NOAA page for the Gulf of Mexico is the "Gulf of America" page, which provides scientific information about the Gulf's oceanography and dynamics.  
**Sources:** aoml.noaa.gov
